BROWN & WILLIAMSON TOBACCO CORPORATION RESEARCH, DEVELOPMENT & ENGINEERING INTERNAL CORRESPONDENCE TO: Dr. P. L. Aulbach CC: Mr. R. W. Dawson Mr. G. F. Piner Mr. D. S. Roth Mr. C. F. Gregory FROM: Ms. D. R. Ross DATE: October 20, 1983 SUBJECT: ROUTINE QC INSPECTION OF COMPOUNDED FLAVORS AND INGREDIENTS FOR EXPORT/144 In the future, I will not be performing routine quality control tests on compounded flavors and/or flavor ingredients for export overseas; the Petersburg Quality Department staff will be responsible for routine inspection of these materials. However, I should be contacted if there is any question about the quality of a material or if a material is considered unacceptable. The new Inspection Program Protocol is described below. One 4 fl. oz. sample and one 1/2 fl. oz. sample of each flavoring or flavor ingredient to be exported should be sent to the Branch Flavor Inspection Laboratory for testing. If the flavoring or flavor ingre- dient passes all tests, the material may be transferred to a labeled shipping container, and the 4 fl. oz. sample representing the material is forwarded to International and External Technical Services (IETS). A copy Df the completed analysis sheet for the sample should be marked with the material's specifications and sent to IETS with the 4 fl. oz. sample. The drummed material will remain at the Branch until IETS gives final approval. D. R. R. DRR/klc 0207e
